title: Project on Roosevelt Island
description: This drawing was a gift from Wynn Kramarsky and refers to Kawamata's most significant American project, a construction built on and over the remains of New York's mid-19th century smallpox sanitorium, on what is now Roosevelt Island. Kawamata makes many of these constructed model/drawings along the lines that Christo does -- both to work out the design in conventional ways, and to raise money for the actual project through their sale. (He doesn't sell the actual project components. It is simply staged for the public.) Kawamata worked on this project while doing a residency at P.S. 1 that same year.
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Fogg Museum, Gift of Sarah-Ann and Werner H. Kramarsky
medium: Cardboard, balsawood, blue print paper on mat board
provenance: Tadashi Kawamata, sold; to Sarah-Ann and Werner H. Kramarsky, New York, New York, gift; to Harvard University Art Museums, 2001.
